alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:26AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike and southwestern Bullock Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1023 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Troy Municipal Airport, or 7 miles northwest of Troy, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Linwood, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, Beans Crossroads, China Grove, Sandfield, High Ridge, Orion and Josie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Alabama.
